abstract: Great Britain's Exchequer chancellor George Osborne makes surprise promise in budget meeting with British lawmakers that country will meet NATO military spending target for next 10 years; pledge is welcomed by American officials who have been pressuring Britain on issue for months.
lead_paragraph: The British government had been under pressure from the U.S., which had expressed concern about declining spending amid increasing global security challenges.

headline.main: Britain Pledges to Hit NATO Military Spending Target
headline.print_headline: Britain Vows to Hit Target for Spending on Military

snippet: The British government had been under pressure from the U.S., which had expressed concern about declining spending amid increasing global security challenges.
